intro: Coronopus serratus, commonly known as the serrated coronopus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
